title.narrative: Emergency Nutrition Response to Affected Population of Bale Zone

description.narrative:
Erratic rainfall resulting in major crop losses due to El Niño, is once again resulting in high levels of food insecurity and malnutrition. Further to the hotspot classification having been released in December 2015, in comparison to the August 2015 hotspot classification, it shows a rise in the percentage of hotspot priority 1 (from 34% to 43%) while there has been a decrease in priority 2 (46% to 36%) in December 2015. Looking at the 10% decrease in priority 2 and 9% increase in priority 1 it is clear that many woredas have shifted from priority 2 to priority 1 between August and December, 2015. Most of the hotspot woredas (28.3%) are located in the Oromia region, the region this intervention intends to target. The targeted woredas for this action were identified further to consultation with the ENCU, the most evident gap being in Bale Zone of Oromia Region. Through USAID/OFDA funding, GOAL has facilitated a CMAM program since 2005, aimed at increasing the capacity of local government and community structures to prevent, mitigate, and respond to the impacts of malnutrition across targeted woredas in Ethiopia. CMAM supports a system that treats malnutrition but also raises awareness of service availability which brings children timely treatment before further complications and therefore reduces mortality. This reflects the high recovery rate (97.6%) achieved to date in the GOAL nutrition assisted programmes.
This intervention will implement CMAM in 9 woredas of Bale Zone in Oromia Region. Specifically in the following woredas Agarfa, Berbere, Dawe Sere, Dolo Mena, Dinsho, Gasera, Giner, Harena Bulukk, Medea and Wolabu. Through this grant GOAL will implement 4 components of CMAM: Outpatient Therapeutic Programme, Stabilization Centres, Community Mobilization, and Training of Health Extension Workers and Health Workers (1,260) on the management of acute malnutrition and training on Infant and Young Child Feeding Practices (IYCF). A total of 900 Health Development Army will be trained on community mobilization. In addition Targeted Supplementary Feeding for children under five and pregnant and lactating women based on the most recent screening will be provided to a total of 12,548 beneficiaries. “In early 2016 GOAL Ethiopia conducted an international tender for CSB and Oil with a view to shortlisting/prequalifying potential suppliers. GOAL will request quotes from this supplier list based on the grant requirement”.Through this grant GOAL will establish 172 OTP, and 34 Stabilization centers providing a service to approximately 2,374 Severely Acutely Malnourished children under five. A baseline and end line survey will also be implemented through this action.
OTP will be established as follows Agarfa 28, Berbere 17, Dawe Sere 18, Dolo Mena 15, Dinsho 10, Gasea 18, Giner 27, Harena Buluklu 17 Medea Wolabu 22
SC will be established as follows Agarfa 4, Berbere 4, Dawe Sere 4, Dolo Mena 4, Dinsho 3, Gasea 3, Giner 4, Harena Buluklu 4, Medea Wolabu 4
